name: A Proposal for the Dartmouth Summer Research Project on Artificial Intelligence
description: First time AI is mentioned.

name: The Darthmouth Summer Research Project on Artificial Intelligence
description: Seminal event for AI as a field.

name: A Logical Calculus of the Ideas Immanent in Nervous Activity
description: A first mathematical model of the nervous system as a network of simple logical elements, later know as Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs). This work is seminal in the fields of cognitive science, computational neuroscience, computer science, and artificial intelligence.
places: University of Illinois, College of Medecine

name: A Mathematical Theory of Communication
description: Seminal paper that gives rise to the field of information theory.

name: Computing Machinery and Intelligence
description: Introduction of the imitation game, now known as the Turing Test—a test of a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behaviour.

name: Logic Theorist
description: Development of the first computer program deliberately engineered to perform automated reasoning, and introduction of the symbolic reasoning paradigm.

name: The Perceptron: A Perceiving and Recognizing Automaton
description: First description and implementation of a perceptron, a simple neural net.

name: The Perceptron: A Probabilistic Model for Information Storage and Organization in the Brain
description: Theoretical paper on the perceptron.
Machines will be capable, within twenty years, of doing any work a man can do.

name: Language and Machines: Computers in Translation and Linguistics
description: A thourough and harsh review of machine translation that contributes to an end of funding in the USA for almost 20 years.
editor: National Academy of Sciences, National Research Council

name: Perceptrons: An Introduction to Computational Geometry
description: A criticism of Rosenblatt's perceptron that marks a halt in research in the field of neural computation and connectionist learning. The authors claim that neural networks will need multiple layers containing multiple neurons to be functional—something that does not exist at the time, and will not exist until 1989. This discourages reaserch on the connectionist approach for several years.

In from three to eight years we will have a machine with the general intelligence of an average human being. I mean a machine that will be able to read Shakespeare, grease a car, play office politics, tell a joke, have a fight. At that point the machine will begin to educate itself with fantastic speed. In a few months it will be at genius level and a few months after that its powers will be incalculable.

name: Artificial Intelligence: A General Survey
description: A harsh review of the state of AI research in the UK.
In no part of the field have the discoveries made so far produced the major impact that was promised.

name: R1/ XCON
description: A production-rule-based system to assist in ordering computer systems by automatically selecting the computer system components based on customers' requirements.

name: AAAI'80
description: First AAAI conference on Artificial Intelligence

name: Fifth Generation Computer Systems
description: Japan's Ministry of International Trade and Industry launches the Fifth Generation Computer Systems (FGCS) 10-year project. Its ambitious goals ultimately led to commercial failure.
editor: Ministry of International Trade and Industry

name: LM-2
description: Symbolics releases the LM-2 machine, a commercialization of the MIT Lisp Machine.

name: Neural Networks and Physical Systems with Emergent Collective Computational Abilities
description: Introduction of what is now known as the Hopfield net, which proves that a neural network can learn and process information.

name: Strategic Computing Initiative
description: The Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) funds research into advanced computer hardware and artificial intelligence for 10 years. The estimated total budget expended is $1B.

name: Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
description: First CHI conference and the emergence of human factors in computing systems

name: The Society of Mind
description: Construction of a model of human intelligence, based on the interactions between a multitude of simple parts called "agents".

name: Learning Representations by Back-Propagating Errors
description: Popularization of the backpropagation method for training neural networks.

name: Manpower and Personel Integration (MANPRINT)
description: Seminal work in the field of Human Systems Integration, with ties to academic fields of industrial engineering and experimental psychology.

name: Backpropagation Applied to Handwritten Zip Code Recognition
description: Early implmentation of a Convolutional Neural Network, applied to hand written digit recognition for Zip code numbers provided by the US Postal Service. The publication is associated with the prototype LeNet-1, considered one of the first genuinly useful applications of neural networks.

name: WorldWideWeb: Proposal for a HyperText Project
description: Management proposal for the development of the WorldWideWeb.

name: WWW is released in the public domain
description: CERN releases the WorldWideWeb software in the public domain

name: Support-Vector Networks
description: Seminal paper on Support Vector Machines (SVMs), a highly common classification technique.

name: Deep Blue beats Kasparov
description: The IBM chess-playing expert system Deep Blue, first developed in 1985 under the name ChipTest (Carnegie Mellon University), then Deep Thought (IBM), wins 2/6 games of chess against world champion Garry Kasparov. It then won a 6-game match against Kasparov in 1997.

name: Long Short-Term Memory
description: Introduction of the LSTM model, the most common modern type of Recurrent Neural Network (RNN).

name: GeForce 256
description: NVIDIA releases the world's first Graphics Processing Unit (GPU), the GeForce 256.

name: Multi-Agent Systems: An Introduction to Distributed Artificial Intelligence
description: A complete and coherent overview of the theoretical foundations of Multi-Agent Systems (MAS).
places: Laboratoire d'informatique, de robotique et de microélectronique de Montpellier

description: […] Artificial intelligence, a technology field that for decades has overpromised and undelivered. […] At its low point, some computer scientists and software engineers avoided the term artificial intelligence for fear of being viewed as wild-eyed dreamers.

name: Stanley: the Robot that won the DARPA Grand Challenge
description: Stanley is a self-driving car developed for high-speed desert driving without manual intervention. Stanley won the 2005 DARPA Grand Challenge.
places: Stanford Artificial Intelligence Laboratory;Volkswagen of America, inc.;Intel Research;Mohr Davidow Ventures

name: Launch of AWS S3 and EC2
description: Launch of the Simple Storage Service (S3) for securely and privately storing data, as well as the Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) for instant access to computer processing power.

name: ImageNet Classification with Deep Convolutional Neural Networks
description: The CNN AlexNet greatly outperforms state of the art in the ImageNet 2012 Challenge.
We should be able to do 90 percent of miles driven [autonomously] within three years.

name: Deep Learning
description: A review of the state of deep learning.

name: Deep unsupervised learning using non equilibrium thermodynamics
description: Introduction of the concept of diffusion to machine learning.

name: OpenAI
description: Founding of OpenAI as a non-profit with the intent of developing "safe and beneficial" artificial general intelligence (AGI).

name: Attention is all you need
description: Introduction of the transformer architecture.

name: A100
description: NVIDIA releases the A100 GPU, now a standard for training AI models

name: DALL-E
description: OpenAI reveals DALL-E, an image-generation system that uses a modified version of GPT 3.

name: Highly Accurate Protein Structure Prediction with AlphaFold
description: Introduction of a computational method to predict protein structures.

name: MidJourney
description: Midjourney Inc. releases Midjourney.

name: Stable Diffusion
description: Stability AI releases Stable Diffusion.

name: ChatGPT
description: OpenAI releases GPT 3.5 – ChatGPT.

name: Twitter acquisition
description: Elon Musk acquires Twitter for $44B.

name: Llama-1
description: Meta releases Llama-1.

name: Grok
description: xAI releases Grok.

name: Gemini
description: Google releases Gemini-1.

name: Nobel Prize in Physics
description: Hopfield and Hinton receive the Nobel Prize in Physics for their foudational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks.
editor: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences

name: DeepSeek R1
description: DeepSeek releases the R1 reasoning model with an open source license.
We predict that the impact of superhuman AI over the next decade will be enormous, exceeding that of the Industrial Revolution.

Whether highly agentic systems ultimately promote or degrade human development depends not on their technological capabilities but on the way they are integrated into society—a theme explored throughout this Report
